vote.title: To Recognize the Clintonville-Beechwold Community Resource Center for their 50 years of Service to the Columbus Community
vote.description:
Title
 
To Recognize the Clintonville-Beechwold Community Resource Center for their 50 years of Service to the Columbus Community
 
Body
 
WHEREAS, The Clintonville-Beechwold Community Resources Center (CRC) was founded in 1971 by a group of Clintonville residents who evaluated the needs of the Clintonville/Beechwold area and realized that neighbors could help neighbors; and
 
WHEREAS, The CRC was initially supported by a contribution from the congregation of North Broadway United Methodist Church, and other area churches quickly added their support. CRC's Choice Food Pantry has grown tremendously as the staff and leadership continue to develop programs to serve community needs; and
                 
WHEREAS, As part of the century-old settlement house movement, CRC is a community-based social services agency guided by the core values of justice, adaptability, efficiency, engagement, and dignity; and
 
WHEREAS, The CRC has expanded their community programs to include family services, a kinship care program, senior supportive services, and youth services (kids club); and 
 
WHEREAS, The key to the CRC's success in providing community-based services are the dedicated staff members, who approach patrons with compassion and understanding; now, therefore
 
BE IT RESOLVED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE CITY OF COLUMBUS:
 
That this Council does hereby recognize the Clintonville-Beechwold Community Resource Center for their 50 years of Service to the Columbus Community.
